job_title: Online Adjunct Professor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The system they have for online teaching is about the best I have ever seen.  The support I get from my Dean, Curriculum Support Specialist, and Curriculum Design Specialist is superb!  The students strongly trend towards the high-quality end of the spectrum, and the overwhelming majority are a pleasure to teach.
cons: I have nothing negative to say.

pros: If you want a sane, and drama free environment this is not the place for you.
cons:
Horrible environment.
A lot of gossip 
Upper management is a revolving door

job_title: Lead Faculty in Altamonte Springs, FL
pros: Student engagement. Mentorship and coaching. Work-life balance.
cons: The Surgical Technologist program chair.

job_title: Adjunct Teacher in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The online courses were not the worst I have seen.
cons: Micromanagement, no professional development. They run students through the program who lack the basic skills to graduate high school. The management is petty and clueless.

job_title: Assistant Professor, Sciences for Health in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Very nice Staff and students.
cons: Very disorganized when company was sold to corporate. No communication was available between staff and corporate office in NYC.

pros: During pandemic, many of us had to move remote and the management did a great job supporting us and getting us all the necessary training and equipment we needed.
cons: After the sale in March, there didn't seem to be any focus on getting new students so many of the leaders left and it seemed like the company was going nowhere.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: At one time, it was an amazing place to work. I planned on working there until retirement years down the road.
cons: After the College was sold, everything went downhill. I could not get out of there fast enough.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Altamonte Springs, FL
pros: Get to teach motivated students.
cons: Pay could be definitely be better.

job_title: Financial Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: i do not have many pros except i met good people
cons: there was no growth in the company

pros: Since your manager is unlikely to understand your job, you can really make what you want out of it. There's freedom to create your own projects and make your own decisions. Also, it's a job.
cons: The people running this school know nothing about education. The school hides behind the nonprofit label, but it is run just like a for-profit.  Employees are subjected to mandatory Scientology (Pacific Institute) training. Nepotism is rampant, and everyone's got a brother or son who owns a company that provides services to the school. The admissions process is a joke, with admissions reps doing everything possible to enroll even the most unfit of students. The school offers entrance testing accommodations to students with disabilities and to those for whom English is a second language, but then provides no such services once the person becomes an actual student. Students are held to ridiculously low standards, and God  help you if you end up in the hospital with one of the nursing graduates looking after you. Can't calculate a proper drug dosage to give your patient? Bah. No big deal. Pass 'em through!

job_title: Default Prevention Advisor in Gainesville, FL
pros: The Co-workers were awesome, friendly, helpful people. Very hands on with the students which is beneficial to them and to the company.
cons: The company was having financial difficulties and underwent significant changes around the time I left. New management pretty much helped things go horribly wrong, things like theft and poor customer service led to more employment changes. Things were confusing and no one let anyone know anything until the last minute.

review_title: Has many bad reviews for a reason.
pros: Helping students and being able to assist people in need to better their future.
cons: Hostile work environment, management is unprofessional, a lot of pressure from Admissions. The school is strictly numbers driven, not student or employee focused and doesn't stick to its statement of providing an "extraordinary educational experience". Resources are very limit to students, you are pressured to enroll a student at any cost on their first visit and push them through a process which takes hours. Seems their corporate management is completely uncaring to what happens on this campus.

pros: Most fellow employees are great and respective of one another. If i was able to only todo what my job description was, I'd have enjoyed it more. The students were he best part.
cons: Unorganized, Self Unaware, disrespectful towards their employees, inconsiderate, poor pay for job requirements, don't hold accurate people accountable, REALLY REALLY BAD MANAGEMENT, super micro management, management constantly validating their position, favoritism,Unable to follow their own policies, DONT TRUST HUMAN RESOURCE.

review_title: The school could actually make a difference
pros: The mission statement of the school unfortunately is not implemented by the upper management, the school could actually make a difference in people’s lives but the have the wrong people with the wrong attitude in managing possessions, making it impossible to create a positive impact in the community
cons: Rewarding when a students accomplish their goal

review_title: I learned many life experiences at City College.
job_title: Program Manager in Altamonte Springs, FL
pros: I helped students to accomplish their goal by completing their degree and finding the job of their dream.
cons: It was a difficult task as the student as any other students have great challenges with finances, family and other factor to help them complete their goals.

review_title: Laid back position when hitting your numbers
pros: Very laid back, Schedule fluctuates to be able to utilize your day time for errands
cons: several levels of management only one or 2 of which is actually on campus so the pressure from corporate comes down the pipeline to the admissions reps to enroll more students.

pros: Great Company overall! Owners care about employees and the company has a sense of family values. The company has a good vision and direction in most areas.
cons: Some choices in upper management were made to only advance one individual at the expense of many other valuable employees. This caused immediate turmoil and turnover.

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Decent pay. Work life balance is good. Decent co-workers if you can find them.
cons:
Worked in the Career Services department. Worst career experience ever. Management at the time was micro managing and told us that she doesn't trust us and that we don't get any work done. That was a huge lie. Goals are unrealistic, students are extremely difficult to work with. Never a straight answer when it comes to the correct placement. No training. Way to much responsibilities and no possible way of getting work done. 

Corporate and upper management are constantly covering their jobs.

review_title: Nightmare that is Admissions of City College
job_title: Admissions Representative in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Good pay, nice desk area, free food during meetings, and good healthcare. Your colleagues are really great people, but the upper management are horrendous.
cons:
You are not put in a position to succeed. 

No wifi for employees which is baffling,  micromanaged by 4-5 different supervisors on an hourly basis, constant passive aggressive emails from management, unpaid/partial pay during hurricanes, no paid sick days, schedule is inconsistent, and you are the scapegoat of everything going wrong with the school.

review_title: I enjoy working--helping with printing, faxing, data entry, filing, and most of all helping students in the library.
pros: I appreciate the personal concern the professors have for one another, and for the director of admissions, of finance, etc.
cons: I sometimes don't have enough work to do.  I enjoy learning new things and I haven't been given that encouragement.

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: High paying job and great coworkers. Some flexibility in schedules. Nice professors who really care about students. Some decent benefits as well.
cons: Management is in cohesive. Students deserve more from the school, lack of communication, lack of integrity and tons of turn over in the office

review_title: City College in Florida offer Extraordinary, Educational, Experience!
pros: Public company that works diligently to give employees and graduates opportunities to better their lives and contribute to their community.
cons: If you like a smaller company that things big....then this is a downside.

review_title: Great small business to work for short term

review_title: Sign 'em up, at all cost....to them!

FA director doesn't is a corporate puppet. If corporate says it, there's not rebuttal, no question, no matter what it is. I don't know if it's because of her age but she never used discernment.

pros: A really great place to work
